body: Unfortunately the themes are a third party component outside our control.

If it can't be fixed on the ZAP side, what's the third party I should report this to?

Is it [FlatLaf](https://github.com/JFormDesigner/FlatLaf)?
Yeah, though it also just occurred to me that purple and blue might simply be the default link colours/styles and not controlled by the theme at all.

Don't think that those two label colors are defined in FlatLaf...

Probably some hard-coded color value in those two labels.
Or if HTML text is used, color could be also defined in HTML.

BTW to check whether dark theme is active, use static method `FlatLaf.isLafDark()`.
Maybe we should be using `flatlaf-swingx` as well? Those two labels are `JXHyperlink`s.
That helps, it does not show them as visited (but I don't think it matters in this context/use).

issue.title: Use FlatLaf add-on for SwingX

repository.name: zaproxy
repository.description: The ZAP by Checkmarx Core project

issue.body:
Improves rendering of some of the SwingX components.

Fix #8760.
